p: The inhibitory effects of rutin on GABA transaminase (GABA-T) and succinate-semialdehyde dehydrogenase have been indicated in numerous in-vitro studies. Inhibition of the two enzymes in the brain tissue increases GABA levels and may have therapeutic applications in neurological disorders. In addition, GABA-T is known as an important target for some of the drugs effective in the brain. Therefore, the inhibition of flavonoids by these enzymes may lead to exhibiting neuro-pharmacological effects (Tao etÂ al. 2008). Therefore, it seems that improving memory and learning in the group receiving rutin in our study may also be due to increased amount of GABA.
